snippet: Sony, Sharp and Panasonic have all reported significant losses, their boom years ended by global crisis and their own poor decisions.
abstract: Sony, Sharp and Panasonic report significant losses; Sharp forecasts a 450 billion yen ($5.6 billion) full-year loss, warning that it has 'material doubts' about its ability to survive; Panasonic’s shares lose a fifth of their value in Tokyo after the company forecasts a 765 billion yen ($9.6 billion) annual net loss from write-downs in its solar-power, battery and mobile handset businesses; Sony posts a net loss of 15.5 billion yen ($194 million) for the quarter, blaming falling sales in almost every product it sells.
lead_paragraph: Sony, Sharp and Panasonic have all reported significant losses, their boom years ended by global crisis and their own poor decisions.

headline.seo: Sony, Sharp and Panasonic Report Significant Losses
